intro: Euphrasia olympica, commonly known as the Olympic eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe, particularly the Alps and the Balkans. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows and forested areas. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its medicinal properties, historically used to treat eye ailments and skin conditions. Euphrasia olympica is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
